nodes.text: The Lord Nyax's Cult hideout was a building on the planet Corellia that served as the headquarters of the religious organization known as the Cult of Lord Nyax during the Galactic Civil War.

The building was the secret hideout of the Followers of Nyax, dangerous fanatics who worshiped the ancient Corellian ghost Lord Nyax and sought to terrorize the citizens of Corellia. While Lord Nyax was only a mythological character, a man who referred to himself as Lord Nyax was leading the Cult from the hideout. A shrine was located in the courtyard of the hideout, it contained eight skulls and eight lightsabers, likely those of Jedi killed by Darth Vader.

After he finally managed to escape the Cult, following the Battle of Yavin, the former Follower of Nyax Lock Vlash intended to earn some money by selling the location of the hideout to any adventurer willing to visit it. Circa 1 ABY, The Rebel agent Pashna Starkiller dispatched a spacer to the Cult of Nyax hideout in order to retrieve an Imperial dossier with information concerning a particularly ruthless Imperial commander.

The Lord Nyax Cult hideout was a location in the 2003 video game Star Wars Galaxies, a massively multiplayer online-role playing game developed by Sony Online Entertainment and published by LucasArts, prior to its closure on December 15, 2011. This location was added to the game with the update named "Publish 1", released on August 3, 2003.
